title: Calories in a Cheese Quesadilla
meta_description: Learn calories in a quesadilla cheese with full nutrition facts, macros, protein, fat, and easy tweaks for variations under 160 characters.
assumptions: Two 8-inch flour tortillas, 1/4 cup shredded cheddar cheese, cooked on dry skillet; no added oil, salsa, or fillings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by tortilla size, cheese type, brand, cooking method, and added ingredients. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A cheese quesadilla provides about 450 kcal and 15 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in a cheese quesadilla?
faqs.a: Approximately 450 kcal for a basic version with two flour tortillas and cheddar cheese.

faqs.q: What are the macros for a quesadilla cheese?
faqs.a: About 50 g carbs, 15 g protein, 20 g fat, with 3 g fiber and 800 mg sodium.

faqs.q: Does cooking oil add calories to a cheese quesadilla?
faqs.a: Yes, 1 tsp oil adds ~40 kcal; dry cooking keeps it lower.

faqs.q: How much protein in a quesadilla cheese?
faqs.a: Around 15 g from the cheese; adding meat boosts it significantly.

faqs.q: Are cheese quesadillas high in sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, typically 800 mg or more due to cheese and tortillas; opt for low-sodium versions.
